402: Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere. As a team member of our naviHealth product, we help change the way health care is delivered from hospital to home supporting patients transitioning across care settings. This life-changing work helps give older adults more days at home. We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join our team, it’s your chance to improve the lives of millions while doing your life’s best work.(sm) Why naviHealth? At naviHealth, our mission is to work with extraordinarily talented people who are committed to making a positive and powerful impact on society by transforming health care. naviHealth is the result of almost two decades of dedicated visionary leaders and innovative organizations challenging the status quo for care transition solutions. We do health care differently and we are changing health care one patient at a time. Moreover, have a genuine passion and energy to grow within an aggressive and fun environment, using the latest technologies in alignment with the company’s technical vision and strategy. The Solutions Management team is responsible for driving the solution design, evolution, and overall profitability of the portfolio of technology-enabled clinical and care management programs for core service lines for naviHealth to improve value created for naviHealth, patients, current customers, and go to market growth strategy. The team will also be responsible for partnering with the New Solutions and Business Development teams to ensure an integrated go to market customer, patient and provider experience as new solutions scale through solution maturity. As a member of the Solutions Management team, the Solutions Manager plays a critical role in executing the overall solution strategy for naviHealth’s core inpatient post-acute care (IP-PAC) service lines of business including Health Plan & PGP Medicare Advantage Plans and Value Based Contracts (Bundles, ACO, and Direct Contracting Entities). The Solutions Manager will collaborate with cross functional teams across the enterprise to manage the discovery, ideation and execution of the core IP-PAC offerings identified initiatives in support the company’s purpose of improving the healthcare experience for seniors to live a more fulfilling life. This role will work with an array of internal and external stakeholders and acts as an intermediary between customers, internal functional teams, and the digital product team to drive enhancements and modifications with the core IP-PAC service lines of business using data-driven insights to help solve business problems and improve the value created for naviHealth, patients, and customers. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities: Understand naviHealth’s business and how the core solutions can be enhanced to better support long term growth and achieve expected clinical and financial outcomes Define business rationale, associated solution workflows and digital product features for identified enhancements or modifications within assigned core IP-PAC lines of business Collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders to prioritize and deliver solution enhancements to meet the needs of naviHealth’s business and customers Clearly communicate solution ideas, value statements and business justification across all levels of the organization for enhancements or customer required changes Convey high level business value and features to Digital Product Owners and other functional owners for development execution Develop operational plans with measurable contribution towards the achievement of operational and company KPIs Monitor and synthesize competitive market trends and opportunities to enhance value delivery of core business solutions Document and maintain repository for all solution overviews, specification documents, standard workflows, and customer specific modifications Perform other duties and responsibilities as required, assigned, or requested Be able to travel as required You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline 5+ years of relevant work experience Experience using Microsoft Office products and applications, with particular emphasis on PowerPoint and visual communication Demonstrated analytic acumen, ability to leverage data to drive decision making and improve outcomes Demonstrated solid communication, presentation, and collaboration skills, with demonstrated ability to drive consensus across a wide group of stakeholders Proven ability to quickly grasp complex concepts and then translate them for less technical audiences while simultaneously being able to dive into the details when needed Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree Healthcare experience Proven ability to be self-driven with solid sense of urgency, requires minimal oversight to drive initiatives to closure Proven ability to be organized with demonstrated ability to establish priorities, hold cross functional partners accountable and ultimately achieve results Proven ability to work comfortably and effectively in a rapidly evolving environment and convert ambiguity to clarity About naviHealth Being a pioneer in post-acute management and care transitions with 19 years of experience, naviHealth is uniquely positioned to manage patients, improve clinical and financial outcomes, and share risk with payors and providers. We provide clinical service support alongside proprietary technology and advisory solutions that empower health systems, health plans and post-acute providers to navigate care episodes across the continuum, with the goal of reducing waste and improving patient outcomes. Our values We care about the people we serve. We care about each other. We care about our communities. We embrace innovation. We like simple. Careers with Optum. Our objective is to make health care simpler and more effective for everyone. With our hands at work across all aspects of health, you can play a role in creating a healthier world, one insight, one connection and one person at a time. We bring together some of the greatest minds and ideas to take health care to its fullest potential, promoting health equity and accessibility. Work with diverse, engaged and high-performing teams to help solve important challenges. California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island or Washington residents is $85,000 to $167,300. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. *All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.
